cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet a named tropical storm or hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to bend northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Morgan City/Intracoastal City

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted west of Intracoastal City, LA; Texas coast not included
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, Louisiana, eastward to the Alabama/Florida border including Lakes Pontchartrain and Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward to the Alabama–Florida border
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (forecast 1–2 ft possible along nearby coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of experiencing sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts could approach gale force Friday night through Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–2 ft above ground level possible along the upper Texas–southwest Louisiana coast, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain beginning Friday could total 3–5 inches, locally higher, producing localized flash flooding around Port Arthur
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat mainly east of the port; elevated seas and short-period swells may disrupt vessel movements and lightering operations
